reviewText: I played like 30 minutes, but that is the limit of how much I could bear. First of all, Russian is my native language, so I'll be talking about game itself, rather than the fact that there's no English localization.\nSo, about character creation. There are seven classes: Witch (female), Archer (female), Swordsman (male), Paladin (female), Canoneer (male), Rogue (male), Sorceress (female). See those remarks I placed in the brackets? You got it right, all class are gender locked and there is nothing you can do about it. Next, you've got 5 choices of ugly faces (sorry, but I cannot see anyone find those faces good, or even ok") and 5 choices or hairstyle. Ok
recommended: done.\nOnce I logged in with my character

reviewText:
Please read the rest of my review if you need help to remove this game from your library after adding it by accident

If you want to read actual reviews for this game, change your localization to Russian in the steam client and the Russian reviews will appear.-- Don't complain about the legitimate English reviewers here fore-warning about such an uncommon language barrier in the English focused Steam Store. This is a natural reaction when the wrong audience is being invited. --

The game is only available in Russian - you won't be able to start the game without knowledge of the language or clicking around hitting random things and getting lucky. The game has a history of not being very attractive (you know how to Google, I'm sure). The game had an English version made called Rosh Online. If that game were here, it might have stood a chance against the largely English lingual audience and market that is attracted by Steam. This game, however, really should not appear with an English store page as it is very misleading. That much will be obvious from the other English reviews.

----
If you do not speak Russian and did not see the Not Available in your Language" message before installing this game
date:
here are the two things that will likely go through your mind causing you distress and regret after hitting the install button.

1. "I wish there was an easy way to remove games I can't understand from my library."
and
2. "I wish my News Feed wouldn't clutter with announcements I cannot read for a game that has a store page written in English
recommended:
which I can read."

Well you are in luck

To remove this game from your library:Originally posted by crimsonfate :If you click on your Steam username at the top right corner of the client and go to account details then you should see an option to remove the game from your account. Valve added the option a few months ago for free or free to play games. Thanks
hoursPlayed:
CrimsonFate c:
UPDATE 2016/01/17: You must now click "View licenses and product key activations" under Store & Purchase History to view the list where you can opt to remove the F2P games from your account.

Appendage:
This review is heavily focused on the language barrier presented to English speakers. It also presents a solution to what will be a problem for anyone (not only English speakers) who install this game and did not realize it is not available in their own language. I thought it was written pretty clearly
voteText: but some people seem to be misreading it.\n\nThis game was a disappointment for me and I only offer advice to fellow players who might be in the position I described in my review and looking to remove this game from their library. Maybe they will come down here to read reviews and heed our warning about language barriers before ever seeing some faint
helpfulPercent: orange text and avoid this game all-together. I certainly did not see any warning text
votesHelpful: and even if I did - why should I believe it? The store page is written is pretty respectable English
votesTotal: is it not?\n\nI'm trying to be empathetic in my review and
commentsCount: my sentiment rings with more than three-quarters of the audience willing to rate my review. And majority rules - Steam is heavily English focused
column16: so adjust your expectations accordingly. What you feel might be personally adequate is fine
column17: but you have to remember that it is not necessarily how everyone else feels.\n\nI've re-arranged components of my review in attempts to be even clearer than I was before. The context remains identical to the original with exception for the summarizing header."

reviewText:
If you're looking for a review you've come to the wrong place, if you're here to cook a pie then read on !
Napoleon from the final puff pastry
You will need:
Ready flaky pastry - 1.5 kg five eggs Flour - 150 g> Sugar - 400 grams Milk - 1200 ml Vanilla sugar - 1 n. Cognac - 1 tbsp. l. Shelled walnuts - glass sequence of preparation: dough defrost naturally at room temperature (defrost time indicated on the package). Cook the custard: grind the egg yolks with a mixer or a whisk to a conventional incandescent and vanilla sugar, flour and brandy to enter the mix. The mixture pour a trickle of milk, stir and cook, stirring constantly. Divide the dough into the desired number of pieces that will later Korzh. Roll out each piece on a board sprinkled with flour. Bake in the oven for about 10 minutes until golden color on a dry baking temperature of 200 degrees. Fluff the cooled cream cakes. If desired, each layer sprinkled with chopped nuts. On top of the cake lightly press smeared with cream and sprinkle all sides crumbs. Add layer cake in a cool place overnight.

reviewText:
A pesar de tener una clasificación baja por parte de los usuarios (40%) tiene un potencial inestimable: es sólido, estable y moderno menguando lógicamente solo en la traducción al inglés al ser de origen asiático y en los gráficos. Su potencial radica en animaciones sólidas, rápidas y sincronizadas, bajos cooldowns, buffs de tiempo prolongado para esos cooldowns y skills poderosas.

Cuando dije sincronizadas me referí a que la latencia, las animaciones y el daño mostrado en la interfaz del juego ocurren casi al mismo tiempo casi como en el clásico Dekaron (otro juego asiático que ya es una reliquia y manifiesta un nivel de acción en un MMORPG nunca vistos hasta la fecha recordando al Diablo II, en el que puedes aumentar incluso tus estadísticas de personaje).

En cuanto al desarrollo del personaje es lógico destacar que es grinding como en todos estos juegos (desgraciadamente más los de tipo asiático) pero así mismo esto es recompensado de una forma muy ingeniosa: no con objetos preciosos y brillantes que caducan en el siguiente parche sino con Puntos Fletta. Los Puntos Fletta es un sistema que te permite dar puntos a importantes habilidades pasivas que suben de nivel al completar el conjunto de puntos que te pide y así sucesivamente (aún no sé cuál es el máximo pero empecé con una habilidad fletta que me aumentaba la rapidez de ataque empleando 10 puntos y ahora me pide 100 para subirla nuevamente de nivel para aumentar aún mas esa rapidez).Todos pensaréis que sigue siendo super grinding pero no es así, porque los Puntos Fletta no tienen límite ni penalización de nivel para obtenerlos de los monstruos: se obtienen al rellenar una barra igual que la vida y el maná, que se va cargando y una vez cargada vuelve a empezar hacia el siguiente punto.
